Module org.cojen.tupl
Package org.cojen.tupl

Interface Scanner

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable
All Known Subinterfaces:
Updater
public interface Scanner
extends AutoCloseable
Scans through all entries in a view and passes them to a consumer. Scanner implementations which perform pre-fetching can be more efficient than a cursor. Any exception thrown by a scan action automatically closes the Scanner.

Scanner instances can only be safely used by one thread at a time, and they must be closed when no longer needed. Instances can be exchanged by threads, as long as a happens-before relationship is established. Without proper exclusion, multiple threads interacting with a Scanner instance may cause database corruption.

See Also:
View.newScanner, Updater

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void close()  
    Comparator<byte[]> comparator()
    Returns a comparator for the ordering of this scanner, or null if unordered.
    byte[] key()
    Returns an uncopied reference to the current key, or null if closed.
    default void scanAll​(EntryConsumer action)
    Calls the given action for each remaining entry, and then closes the scanner.
    boolean step()
    Step to the next entry.
    default boolean step​(long amount)
    Steps over the requested amount of entries.
    byte[] value()
    Returns an uncopied reference to the current value, which might be null or Cursor.NOT_LOADED.

  • Method Details

    • comparator

      Comparator<byte[]> comparator()
      Returns a comparator for the ordering of this scanner, or null if unordered.

    • key

      byte[] key()
      Returns an uncopied reference to the current key, or null if closed. Array contents must not be modified.

    • value

      byte[] value()
      Returns an uncopied reference to the current value, which might be null or Cursor.NOT_LOADED. Array contents can be safely modified.

    • step

      boolean step() throws IOException
      Step to the next entry.
      Returns:
      false if no more entries remain and scanner has been closed
      Throws:
      IOException

    • step

      default boolean step​(long amount) throws IOException
      Steps over the requested amount of entries.
      Parameters:
      amount - amount of entries to step over
      Returns:
      false if no more entries remain and scanner has been closed
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if amount is negative
      IOException

    • scanAll

      default void scanAll​(EntryConsumer action) throws IOException
      Calls the given action for each remaining entry, and then closes the scanner.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • close

      void close() throws IOException
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Throws:
      IOException
